MapDecoration.Dialog: Fortune smiles upon thee! Thou hast found Erdrick's Token.

NonPlayerCharacter.Dialog: "King Lorik will record thy deeds in his Imperial Scroll so thou may return to thy quest later."
"If thou art planning to take a rest, first see King Lorik."
"There was a time when Brecconary was a paradise. Then the Dragonlord's minions came."

DialogCheck.name: PM_Rescued_Princess
DialogCheck.Dialog: "Thank you for saving the Princess."

NonPlayerCharacter.Dialog: "Where oh where can I find Princess Gwaelin?"
"We are merchants who have traveled much in this land. Many of our colleagues have been killed by servants of the Dragonlord."
"Rumor has it that entire towns have been destroyed by the Dragonlord's servants."
"Never does a brave person steal."
"Let us wish the warrior well! May the light be thy strength!"
"If thy hit points are high enough, by all means, enter."
"To become strong enough to face future trials thou must first battle many foes."
"When the sun and rain meet, a Rainbow Bridge shall appear. It's a legend."
"Welcome to Tantegel Castle."
"Welcome to Tantegel Castle."

DialogCheck.name: PM_Rescued_Princess
DialogCheck.Dialog: "Oh, my dearest Gwaelin! I hate thee, [NAME]."

NonPlayerCharacter.Dialog: "Where oh where can I find Princess Gwaelin?"
"[NAME]'s coming was foretold by legend. May the light shine upon this brave warrior."
"In Garinham, look for the grave of Garin. Thou must push on a wall of darkness there."

DialogCheck.name: PM_Carrying_Princess
DialogCheck.Dialog: "Forever shall I be grateful for the gift of my daughter returned to her home, [NAME]. Accept my thanks."
"Now, Gwaelin, come to my side."
Gwaelin then whispers: "Wait a moment, please. I would give a present to [NAME]."
"Please accept my love, [NAME]."
"Even when we two are parted by great distances, I shall be with thee."
"Farewell, [NAME]."

NonPlayerCharacter.Dialog: "I am greatly pleased that thou hast returned, [NAME]. Before reaching thy next level of experience thou must gain [NEXT_LEVEL_XP] experience points."
"Will thou tell me now of thy deeds so they won't be forgotten?"

DialogOption.name: Yes
DialogOption.Dialog: "Thy deeds have been recorded on the Imperial Scrolls of Honor."

NonPlayerCharacter.Dialog: "Goodbye now, [NAME]. Take care and tempt not the Fates."

DialogCheck.name: PM_Given_Princess_Love
DialogCheck.Dialog: "I love thee, [NAME]."

NonPlayerCharacter.Dialog: "Dost thou love me, [NAME]?"

DialogCheck.name: PM_Rescued_Princess
DialogCheck.Dialog: "A word of advice. Save thy money for more expensive armor."

NonPlayerCharacter.Dialog: "East of this castle is a town where armor, weapons, and many other items may be purchased."
"Return to the Inn for a rest if thou art wounded in battle, [NAME]. Sleep heals all."

DialogCheck.name: PM_Rescued_Princess
DialogCheck.Dialog: "Listen to what people say. It can be of great help."

NonPlayerCharacter.Dialog: "If thou hast collected all the treasure chests, a key will be found."
"Once used, the key will disappear, but the door will be open and thou may pass through."

DialogCheck.name: PM_Rescued_Princess
DialogCheck.Dialog: "Oh, brave [NAME]."

NonPlayerCharacter.Dialog: "Dost thou know about Princess Gwaelin?"

DialogOption.name: No
DialogOption.Dialog: "Half a year now hath passed since the Princess was kidnapped by the enemy. Never does the King speak of it, but he must be suffering much."

DialogCheck.name: PM_Acquired_Stones_of_Sunlight
DialogCheck.Dialog: "Be gone with you!!!"

NonPlayerCharacter.Dialog: "I have been waiting long for one such as thee. Take the treasure chest."

MapDecoration.Dialog: Fortune smiles upon thee! Thou hast found the Stones of Sunlight.

NonPlayerCharacter.Dialog: "Thou art most welcome in Brecconary."
"Welcome! Enter the shop and speak to its keeper across the desk."

DialogCheck.name: PM_Rescued_Princess
DialogCheck.Dialog: "Who touches me? I see nothing, nor can I hear."

NonPlayerCharacter.Dialog: "Tell King Lorik that the search for his daughter hath failed. I am almost gone..."
"See King Lorik when thy experience levels are raised."
"There is a town where magic keys can be purchased."
"If thou art cursed, come again."
"Beware the bridges! Danger grows when thou crosses."
"Within sight of Tantegel Castle to the south is Charlock, the fortress of the Dragonlord."
"No, I am not Princess Gwaelin."
"Enter where thou can."
"Watch thy hit points when in the poisonous marsh."
"Go North to the seashore, then follow the coastline West until thou hath reached Garinham."
"Art thou the descendant of Erdrick? Hast thou any proof?"
"Many have been the warriors who have perished on this quest. But for thee I wish success, [NAME]."
"Please, save us from the minions of the Dragonlord."
"Some say that Garin's grave is home to a Silver Harp."
"Welcome to Garinham. May thy stay be a peaceful one."
"Garin, a wandering minstrel of legendary fame, is said to have built this town."
"Many believe that Princess Gwaelin is hidden away in a cave."
"I have heard of one named Nester. Dost thou know such a one?"
"It is said that the princess was kidnapped and taken eastward."

MapDecoration.Dialog: Fortune smiles upon thee! Thou hast found the Fairy Flute.

NonPlayerCharacter.Dialog: "This is the village of Kol."
"Please, save us from the minions of the Dragonlord."
"Dreadful is the South Island. Great strength and skill and wit only will bring thee back from that place."
"Golem is afraid of the music of the flute, so 'tis said."
"East of Hauksness there is a town, 'tis said, where one may purchase weapons of extraordinary quality."
"In legends it is said that fairies know how to put Golem to sleep."
"This bath cures rheumatism."
"Hast thou seen Nester? I think he may need help."

DialogCheck.name: Erdrick's Sword
DialogCheck.Dialog: "Finally thou hast obtained it, [NAME]."

NonPlayerCharacter.Dialog: "Though thou art as brave as thy ancestor, [NAME], thou cannot defeat the great Dragonlord with such weapons. Thou shouldst come here again."
"Art thou the descendant of Erdrick? Hast thou any proof?"
"Rimuldar is the place to buy keys."
"Hast thou been to the Southern Island?"

DialogOption.name: Yes
DialogOption.Dialog: "I have heard that powerful enemies live there."

DialogOption.name: No
DialogOption.Dialog: "To the South, I believe, there is a town called Rimuldar."

NonPlayerCharacter.Dialog: "Hast thou found the flute?"

DialogOption.name: No
DialogOption.Dialog: "Howard had it, but he went to Rimuldar and never returned."

NonPlayerCharacter.Dialog: "No, I have no tomatoes. I have no tomatoes today."
"You are [NAME]? It has been long since last we met."
"Welcome to the town of Rimuldar."
"The scales of the Dragonlord are as hard as steel."
"Art thou the descendant of Erdrick? Hast thou any proof?"
"Who art thou? Leave at once or I will call my friends."
"Over the Western part of this island Erdrick created a rainbow. 'Tis also said that he entered the darkness from a hidden entrance in the room of the Dragonlord."
"Thou shalt find the Stones of Sunlight in Tantegel Castle, if thou has not found them yet."

DialogCheck.name: Fighter's Ring
DialogCheck.Dialog: "All true warriors wear a ring."

NonPlayerCharacter.Dialog: "Is that a wedding ring? Thou seems too young to be married."
"Before long the enemy will arrive."
"Heed my warning! Travel not to the south for there the monsters are fierce and terrible."
"In this world is there any sword that can pierce the scales of the Dragonlord?"
"This is a magic place. Hast thou found a magic temple?"

DialogOption.name: Yes
DialogOption.Dialog: "In this temple do the sun and rain meet."

NonPlayerCharacter.Dialog: "Orwick is late again. I'm starving."
"I am Orwick, and I am waiting for my girlfriend."
"Welcome!"
"Good day, I am Howard. Four steps South of the bath in Kol thou shalt find a magic item."

MapDecoration.Dialog: Fortune smiles upon thee! Thou hast found the Erdrick's Armor.

NonPlayerCharacter.Dialog: "Welcome to Cantlin, the castle town."
"'Tis said that the Dragonlord hath claws that can cleave iron and fiery breath that can melt stone. Dost thou still wish to go on?"

DialogOption.name: No
DialogOption.Dialog: "That is good. No one will say thou art afraid."

NonPlayerCharacter.Dialog: "It is said that many have held Erdrick's armor. The last to have it was a fellow named Wynn."
"Come buy my radishes! They are fresh and cheap. Buy thy radishes today!"
"What shall I get for thy dinner?"
"I know nothing."
"To learn how proof may be obtained that thy ancestor was the great Erdrick, see a man in this very town."
"Grandfather used to say that his friend, Wynn, had buried something of great value at the foot of a tree behind his shop."
"I'm Nester. Hey, where am I? No, don't tell me!"
"'Tis said that Erdrick's sword could cleave steel."
"My Grandfather Wynn once had a shop on the east side of Hauksness."
"Let us wish the warrior well! May the light be thy strength!"
"Thou may go and search. From Tantegel Castle travel 70 leagues to the South and 40 to the East."

MapDecoration.Dialog: Fortune smiles upon thee, [NAME]. Thou hast found Erdrick's Tablet.

The tablet reads as follows: 'I am Erdrick and thou art my descendant. Three items were needed to reach the Isle of Dragons, which is south of Brecconary. I gathered these items, reached the island, and there defeated a creature of great evil. Now I have entrusted the three items to three worthy keepers. Their descendants will protect the items until thy quest leads thee to seek them out. When a new evil arises, find the three items, then fight!'
Fortune smiles upon thee! Thou hast found a herb.
Fortune smiles upon thee! Thou hast found the Fighter's Ring.

NonPlayerCharacter.Dialog: "Thou art brave indeed to rescue me, [NAME]."
"I am Gwaelin, daughter of Lorik."
"Will thou take me to the castle?"

DialogOption.name: No
DialogOption.Dialog: "Will thou take me to the castle?"

DialogCheck.name: PM_Acquired_Staff_of_Rain
DialogCheck.Dialog: "Thou hast no business here. Go away."

DialogCheck.name: PM_Acquired_Silver_Harp
DialogCheck.Dialog: "Thy bravery must be proven. Thus, I propose a test."
"There is a Silver Harp that beckons to the creatures of the Dragonlord."
"Bring this to me and I will reward thee with the Staff of Rain."

NonPlayerCharacter.Dialog: "Thou hast brought the harp. Good. I have been waiting long for one such as thee. Take the treasure chest."

MapDecoration.Dialog: Fortune smiles upon thee! Thou hast found the Staff of Rain.

DialogCheck.name: PM_Acquired_Rainbow_Drop
DialogCheck.Dialog: "Thou hast no business here. Go away."

DialogCheck.name: PM_Acquired_Stones_of_Sunlight
DialogCheck.Dialog: "In thy task thou hast failed. Alas, I fear thou art not the one Erdrick predicted would save us. Go now!"

DialogCheck.name: PM_Acquired_Staff_of_Rain
DialogCheck.Dialog: "In thy task thou hast failed. Alas, I fear thou art not the one Erdrick predicted would save us. Go now!"

DialogCheck.name: Erdrick's Token
DialogCheck.Dialog: "In thy task thou hast failed. Alas, I fear thou art not the one Erdrick predicted would save us. Go now!"

NonPlayerCharacter.Dialog: "Now the sun and rain shall meet and the Rainbow Drop passes to thy keeping."

MapDecoration.Dialog: Fortune smiles upon thee! Thou hast found the Rainbow Drop.
Fortune smiles upon thee! Thou hast found the Silver Harp.
Feel the wind blowing from behind the throne.
Fortune smiles upon thee! Thou hast found the Erdrick's Sword.

NonPlayerCharacter.Dialog: "Welcome, [NAME]. I am the Dragonlord--King of Kings."
"I have been waiting long for one such as thee."
"I give thee now a chance to share this world and to rule half of it if thou will now stand beside me."
"What sayest thou? Will the great warrior stand with me?"

DialogOption.name: Yes
DialogOption.Dialog: "Then half of this world is thine, half of the darkness, and..."
"If thou dies I can bring thee back for another attempt without loss of thy deeds to date."
"Thy journey is over. Take now a long, long rest. Hahahaha..."

DialogScript.label: defeated_dragonlord_first_form
DialogScript.Dialog: The Dragonlord revealed his true self!

DialogScript.label: defeated_dragonlord_second_form
DialogScript.Dialog: Thou hast found the Ball of Light.
Radiance streams forth as thy hands touch the object and hold it aloft.
Across the land spreads the brilliance until all shadows are banished and peace is restored.

DialogScript.label: weapon_and_armor_vendor
DialogScript.Dialog: "We deal in weapons and armor. Dost thou wish to buy or sell anything today?"

DialogOption.name: Buy

DialogCheck.name: gp
DialogCheck.Dialog: "Sorry. Thou hast not enough gold."
"Dost thou wish to buy or sell anything more?"

DialogOption.Dialog: "Dost thou wish to buy or sell anything more?"

DialogOption.name: Sell
DialogOption.Dialog: "The [ITEM]? I will give you [COST] gold pieces for it. Is that okay?"
"Dost thou wish to buy or sell anything more?"

DialogOption.name: No Thank Thee
DialogOption.Dialog: "Very well then. If you change your mind you know where to find me."

DialogScript.label: tool_vendor
DialogScript.Dialog: "Welcome. We deal in tools. What can I do for thee?"

DialogOption.name: Buy

DialogCheck.name: gp
DialogCheck.Dialog: "Sorry. Thou hast not enough gold."
"Dost thou wish to buy or sell anything more?"

DialogOption.Dialog: "Dost thou wish to buy or sell anything more?"

DialogOption.name: Sell
DialogOption.Dialog: "The [ITEM]? I will give you [COST] gold pieces for it. Is that okay?"
"Dost thou wish to buy or sell anything more?"

DialogOption.name: No Thank Thee
DialogOption.Dialog: "I will be waiting for thy next visit."

DialogScript.label: key_vendor
DialogScript.Dialog: "Magic keys! They will unlock any door. Dost thou wish to purchase one for [COST] gold peices?"

DialogOption.name: Yes

DialogCheck.name: gp
DialogCheck.Dialog: "Thou dost not have enough gold."
"I will see thee later."

DialogOption.Dialog: "Here, take this key. Dost thou wish to purchase more?"

DialogScript.label: fairy_water_vendor
DialogScript.Dialog: "Will thou buy some Fairy Water for [COST] gold pieces to keep the Dragonlord's minions away?"

DialogOption.name: Yes

DialogCheck.name: gp
DialogCheck.Dialog: "Thou dost not have enough gold."
"All the best to thee."

DialogOption.Dialog: "I thank thee. Won't thou buy one more bottle?"

DialogCheck.name: gp
DialogCheck.Dialog: "Thou dost not have enough gold."
"Please come again when you have more gold!"

DialogScript.label: innkeeper
DialogScript.Dialog: "Welcome to the Traveler's Inn. Room and board is [COST] gold pieces per night. Dost thou want a room?"

DialogOption.name: Yes

DialogCheck.name: gp
DialogCheck.Dialog: Thou dost not have enough gold.

DialogOption.Dialog: "Good morning! Thou seems to have spent a good night. I shall see thee again."

DialogScript.label: found_nothing
DialogScript.Dialog: [NAME] searched the ground and found nothing.

DialogScript.label: key_chest
DialogScript.Dialog: Fortune smiles upon thee! Thou hast found a key.

DialogScript.label: gold_chest
DialogScript.Dialog: Fortune smiles upon thee! Thou hast found [CHEST_GOLD] gold pieces.

DialogScript.label: torch_chest
DialogScript.Dialog: Fortune smiles upon thee! Thou hast found a torch.

DialogScript.label: herb_chest
DialogScript.Dialog: Fortune smiles upon thee! Thou hast found a herb.

DialogScript.label: wings_chest
DialogScript.Dialog: Fortune smiles upon thee! Thou hast found the Wings of the Wyvern.

DialogScript.label: cursed_belt_chest
DialogScript.Dialog: Fortune smiles upon thee! Thou hast found the Cursed Belt.

DialogCheck.Dialog: But that spell will not work.
But that spell will not work.
But that spell will not work.
But nothing happened.
But that spell will not work.
But that spell will not work.
But that spell will not work.
But that spell will not work.
But that spell will not work.
But that spell will not work.
But that spell will not work.

Tool.name: Fairy Water
Tool.Dialog: [ACTOR] drank the vial of Fairy Water.

Tool.name: Herb
Tool.Dialog: [ACTOR] ate the herb.

DialogCheck.Dialog: A key will open a locked door.
A key ring will open a locked door. Unlike a key it is reusable.

Tool.name: Torch

DialogCheck.Dialog: A torch will come in handy in the dark places of the world.

Tool.Dialog: [ACTOR] lit a torch.

Tool.name: Lantern

DialogCheck.Dialog: A latern will come in handy in the dark places of the world. Unlike a torch it is reusable.

Tool.Dialog: [ACTOR] lit a lattern.

Tool.name: Wings
Tool.Dialog: [ACTOR] threw the Wings of the Wyvern up into the sky.

DialogCheck.Dialog: But nothing happened.
But nothing happened.

Tool.Dialog: [ACTOR] was transported to Tantegel Castle.

Tool.name: Ball of Light
Tool.Dialog: Radiance streams forth as thy hands touch the object and hold it aloft.

Tool.name: Fairy Flute
Tool.Dialog: [ACTOR] blew the Fairy Flute.

Tool.name: Erdrick's Token
Tool.Dialog: [ACTOR] held Erdrick's Token tightly.
But nothing happened.

Tool.name: Staff of Rain
Tool.Dialog: [ACTOR] held the Staff of Rain tightly.
But nothing happened.

Tool.name: Stones of Sunlight
Tool.Dialog: [ACTOR] held the Stones of Sunlight tightly.
But nothing happened.

Tool.name: Rainbow Drop
Tool.Dialog: [ACTOR] held the Rainbow Drop toward the sky.

DialogCheck.Dialog: But no rainbow appeared here.
But no rainbow appeared here.

Tool.Dialog: A rainbow appeared forming a bridge to Charlock Island.

Tool.name: Silver Harp
Tool.Dialog: [ACTOR] played a sweet melody on the harp.

DialogCheck.Dialog: But nothing happened.

Tool.name: Gwaelin's Love
Tool.Dialog: [ACTOR] held the Gwaelin's Love tightly.
"Heed my voice, [ACTOR], for this is Gwaelin."
"To reach the next level thou must raise thy experience points by [NEXT_LEVEL_XP]. My hope is with thee."

DialogCheck.Dialog: "I love thee, [ACTOR]."

Tool.Dialog: "From where thou art now, my castle lies [Y] to the [Y_DIR] and [X] to the [X_DIR]."
"I love thee, [ACTOR]."

InitialState.name: Hero
InitialState.Dialog: "Descendant of Erdrick, listen now to my words. It is told that in ages past Erdrick fought demons with a Ball of Light. Then came the Dragonlord who stole the precious globe and hid it in the darkness."
"Now, [NAME], thou must help us recover the Ball of Light and restore peace to our land. The Dragonlord must be defeated."
"Take now whatever thou may find in these treasure chests to aid thee in thy quest. Then speak with the guards, for they have much knowledge that may aid thee."
